definition: aristocracy
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
surname Hou
the winners become princes and marquises; the losers are vilified as bandits (idiom)/history is written by the victors
pinyin: sheng4 zhe3 wang2 hou2 bai4 zhe3 kou4

definition: see 勝者王侯敗者寇|胜者王侯败者寇[sheng4 zhe3 wang2 hou2 bai4 zhe3 kou4]
pinyin: sheng4 zhe3 wang2 hou2 bai4 zhe3 zei2

definition: aristocracy

sentences.english: Kept hearts in liveries , but mine own was free.
sentences.chinese: 我的心卻仍貴如王侯，自己作主。

sentences.english: Many of the local dignitaries attended his grandfather's funeral.
sentences.chinese: 賣地很多王侯將相都參加了他外祖父的葬禮。

sentences.english: Using the standards for princes and marquises.
sentences.chinese: 用王侯的標準來修建的。

sentences.english: I have seen servants upon horses: and princes walking on the ground as servants.
sentences.chinese: 我看見僕人騎馬，而王侯反像僕人一樣步行。

sentences.english: If lords and princes could obey him, all things would abide by him.
sentences.chinese: 王侯若能持守他，萬物會自動歸順。

sentences.english: I love the nobility, because they are also the mortal.
sentences.chinese: 我愛王侯將相，因爲他們也是凡人。

sentences.english: He that bringeth the searchers of secrets to nothing, that hath made the judges of the earth as vanity.
sentences.chinese: 他使王侯化爲烏有，叫地上士紳成爲虛無。

sentences.english: The relation between the heads and the local lieges was subtle.
sentences.chinese: 縣令長與地方王侯的關係很微妙。

sentences.english: That then I scorn to change my state with kings.
sentences.chinese: 記得你的溫柔多富有，我不願改變這境遇當王侯。

definition: descendants of feudal aristocrats
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
children of the nobility
princes and dukes/aristocrat
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
influential officials/bigwigs
the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
regent/monarch
high official

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
duke (old)/nobleman/gentry
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
